200202.n: Research in Popular and Applied History IV: Topics in Ottoman and Late Ottoman History, 1600-1918

catList: The fourth of series of comporative and appplied workshops in the analysis of elements of popular historical consciousness,including fiction, popular journals and comic strips as well as history education materials. Focuses not only on Turkey but on Southeast Europe as a whole, and creates space for exploring the possibilities of definning and producing alternative educational materials, including textbooks and/or theme kits for teachers and students. More specifically, HIST 634 is devoted to critical investigations of existing accounts of Ottoman "decline" belated modernization and tortuous collapse in history education, as well as the possibilities of improving on such treatments. Does not count as a 600-coded research seminar for graduate students registered in regular SabancÄ± University degree programs.
